column4: “The Fort is still standing.” Great to visit with Steve Wohlfarth and the team at The Fort, the iconic shops for all things western based in Lincoln. The #PPP loan provided critical relief when the pandemic hit and helped keep everyone working. https://t.co/JAO8YvESpT

As the early pandemic took its toll, we worked in Congress with USDA to quickly direct dairy, meat, produce to persons in need. Thankful to Scott Young at Food Bank of Lincoln, who told me, the care boxes are “the coolest product. Easy to distribute, and our clients love them.” https://t.co/UlL75X21e0

The message from our visit this morning with General Excavating & H.R. Bookstrom Construction was, “Business is good.” The #PPP loan program gave needed assurance when the uncertainty of #COVID came upon us. Thank you to both companies for fighting through and building #Nebraska https://t.co/6Rz4505tv8

While our fight against #COVID19 demands our complete attention, other important developments continue to occur. Regarding nuclear security, #Russia and the U.S. are currently engaging in New START talks to put a freeze on warheads for each side––in order to avoid the unthinkable

As we fight past the #COVID19 pandemic, a further policy consideration is the transmission of disease in wildlife markets, as we’ve seen in #China Pleased to join with @RepGraceMeng on the Global Wildlife Trade Biosecurity Act to help prevent future infectious disease outbreaks.

Lincoln Premium Poultry produces two million chickens a week out of #Nebraska Appreciate the deliberate and quick action by the plant to mitigate the spread of #COVID19, enhance workplace safety, and protect jobs for the community. https://t.co/zp0paS8qnb

The #PPP “kept everything flowing through the pandemic” at @PromedcareInc in Fremont. Thanks Tiffany and Andrew for your coordinated and compassionate care for those who need in-home treatment. Spent a little time with Brutus the mascot as well. https://t.co/8jQvD7ckUt

I was looking forward to the Farm-to-School “Crunch-Off” this year. #Nebraska is the defending champ with the largest number of kids eating healthy nutritious food. Here’s the championship highlight from last year. https://t.co/ADexZbiDcd @USDA @FarmtoSchool #F2SMonth

The Paycheck Protection Program was a bipartisan airlift that saved over 300K jobs in #Nebraska I invite you to review my interview about #PPP and the prospects for more #COVID19 relief as we continue to protect the health and well-being of all Americans https://t.co/B85YB8skJe

Great to be with the people at Vireo Resources, a nutraceutical pioneer in Plattsmouth, #Nebraska They received a #PPP loan and kept going strong, as their cleaning supplies and immune support products helped out during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/mAQBVGp5VR

Pender Community Hospital received a #PPP loan, in CARES funding—saving jobs and protecting quality healthcare for Pender and surrounding communities. Appreciate their strong leadership for healthcare in rural #Nebraska https://t.co/p0usxVCcuG

I’m proud of the extraordinary progress at Twelve Clans Unity Hospital in Winnebago. We’ve worked hard for the transition to Tribal leadership of the hospital, which is nearing completion. Highly successful. https://t.co/afaxULr1q8

Great to be in Norfolk today, continuing to see the impact of Paycheck Protection Program loans, which are estimated to have saved 300,000 jobs in #Nebraska during the #COVID19 pandemic. #PPP https://t.co/8BoDpnZGdj

October is Farm to School Month! Now in its 10th year, the Farm to School Program teaches kids about healthy food choices, farm life, and the provenance of their food––connecting the rural to the urban, the farmer to the student. I've long supported it in Congress. @FarmtoSchool

University of #Nebraska Medical Center leads America in infectious disease research and education. Due to a remarkable public-private collaboration, the new Davis Global Center @UNMC will also keep it at the leading edge of pandemic preparedness https://t.co/saLmAQYyX4 #COVID19

Americans want to know if it's possible for Congress to engage in an imaginative, solution-oriented manner––to improve health, increase options, provide better value, and lower cost. I believe the answer is yes. Here are some of my initiatives. https://t.co/TBdHE6nD4h #healthcare

Should the Affordable Care Act ever change, I am committed, as I have long been committed, to ensuring that one thing will not change: people with a preexisting condition will be able to access health insurance https://t.co/Kfw8UcxrzV #PreExistingConditions #ACA

Pleased to see @UNMC take a leadership role in helping prevent animal-human transfer of infectious disease, as we saw with #COVID19 We worked hard in the appropriations process in Congress to advance this research at the height of the pandemic.

The Lewis and Clark Center in #Nebraska City is a gem of the prairie. But it's faced ongoing financial insecurity, compounded by #COVID19 My bill, H.R. 3651, gives the center new flexibility to generate resources to continue operations on its own https://t.co/k4ahdfwkQJ

There's a whole lot of information (and misinformation) out there about #COVID19 Three simple slides from the Centers for Disease Control & Prevention break down your #coronavirus risk based on age, health, and ethnicity @CDCgov https://t.co/hZXXlg92Wy

Tonight the House voted overwhelmingly to fund the government through December 11––protecting farmers and providing nutrition assistance to millions of Americans facing food insecurity due to #coronavirus while also keeping @USCIS whole and working.

As we look forward to victories on the gridiron, I’d like to apprise you of some of our wins in Congress. From #COVID19 relief to protecting our environmental security, here's a list of specific items to ensure the well-being of America and #Nebraska https://t.co/MHz48BWsay

Great news for #Nebraska farmers! @USDA just announced a second round of ag payments (up to $14 billion) to help producers deal with pandemic-related losses. Sign-up will start Monday. More information can be found here: https://t.co/Y5qWJPe5du

Pleased to cosponsor the Pregnant Workers Fairness Act, which just passed the House. It ensures that pregnant workers are provided reasonable accommodations so they don’t have to choose between maintaining a healthy pregnancy and their paycheck.

Like many other industries, fairs have suffered tremendous financial loss due to #COVIDー19 While the #Nebraska State Fair continues in truncated form, I was proud to lead the effort behind the Ag Fairs Rescue Act to provide relief to state & county fairs https://t.co/S5U9VI2Uvx

The unprecedented challenges of the #coronavirus pandemic have only reinforced the important role played by the US Postal Service–-above all for our vulnerable neighbors for whom it may serve as a literal lifeline, and for the increased possible necessity of voting by mail @USPS

Biofuels are an important part of Nebraska’s contribution to our clean energy mix. Unfortunately, this sector has been harmed as well by #coronavirus Here’s a bipartisan effort. #biofuels https://t.co/0m6c1WUHda

Due to #coronavirus, nearly two-thirds of fairs won’t happen this year, causing hardship to communities and ag producers who use fairs to market products and inspire future farmers. Proud to co-sponsor the Ag Fairs Rescue Act to provide some relief to state, county, & local fairs

Six years ago, #ISIS launched its sick genocidal campaign against the #Yazidis, Christians, and Muslim minorities of N. Iraq. Today #Lincoln is home to the largest Yazidi community in America, a wonderfully proud community that is rebuilding—and embracing—all America has to offer

Telehealth, tele-education, and telework are here to stay and are revolutionizing how we think about community. Poor internet in places holds us back. Watch this on #ruralbroadband from the House of Representatives https://t.co/2yIjb7nt0M

Pleased to see the budget shortfall at US Citizenship and Immigration Services addressed in the Senate #COVID relief bill. This key development sets a critical bright line for future negotiations between the House and Senate to prevent furloughs of the good people @USCIS

The Coronavirus Food Assistance Program provides relief to farmers due to supply chain disruptions from #coronavirus I recently sent a letter to @USDA to help the many small, diversified farms and market gardeners in #Nebraska better access this assistance https://t.co/1y4sz8ojJr

COVID caused a digital leap in telehealth, telework, telelearning. As Ranking Member on Ag Appropriations, I noted today our aggressive support for expansive rural broadband so that Americans everywhere can participate in this new structuring of #community https://t.co/Tq3DZqS0KS

The US Citizenship and Immigration Service has a quiet but important presence in Lincoln. Hundreds of its hard-working employees, thru no fault of their own, received notices of possible furlough due to #coronavirus We’re working on a bipartisan solution to fix the problem @USCIS

Months of #coronavirus have given us a glimpse into the daily burden of patients with rapidly progressing terminal diseases like #ALS (Lou Gehrig’s Disease). I invite you to review an op-ed I wrote with Brian Wallach of @iamalsorg that offers a way forward https://t.co/xKlBKwhKET

Lincoln Airport contributes $1B/yr. to our economy, supporting 9K jobs. Delta recently suspended service to Nebraska's capital. I invite you to read my letter to Transp. Sec. Chao asking her to ensure @Delta flies out of Lincoln, as airlines & passengers recover from #coronavirus https://t.co/IVLUDpjgNm

We had a big problem with #coronavirus hitting us hard at the local Tysons plant in Madison. @NorfolkNE Mayor Josh Moenning & the Director of Elkhorn Logan Valley Health Dept Gina Uhing immediately saw the threat and worked aggressively to solve it. Thank you for your leadership! https://t.co/2VA3VsJcJ1
Another milestone in the fight against #ALS was reached today: $25 million from the National Institutes of Health to spur research for a breakthrough. Thank you @NIH @iamalsorg

A bit of good news: Weekly unemployment numbers in #Nebraska fell below 5000 initial claims for the first time since March. Some progress in our recovery from the hardship of #coronavirus https://t.co/6JrnTlVC7R
If you received an unusual debit card in the mail, it may be your economic support payment. If you accidentally threw it away, please contact us. We are here to help. #coronavirus

Last week, Congress passed the Paycheck Protection Program Flexibility Act, which is now the law of the land. It gives small business owners greater time and flexibility in deploying and repaying #PPP loans, which have been a critical lifeline during #coronavirus

For those who've lost loved ones and been sadly delayed in honoring them due to #coronavirus Veterans Administration' national cemeteries will now resume committal and memorial services in accordance with Centers for Disease Control & Prevention guidelines #Vets @DeptVetAffairs

As we recover from #coronavirus, only two months ago unemployment was near Great Depression levels. Thankfully, it's now far lower than expected, with more drops to come—and more work to do. A key has been the Paycheck Protection Program, in which #Nebraska leads. #PPP

Every day during coronavirus, my staff and I have held a call to address your concerns. Today's call was more personal. We wrestled, as a family, as you are wrestling now, with the hurt, anger, and violence in our state and country. As always, please know that we are here for you

In a speech yesterday, I outlined what the coming reality might look like for many of us and what it must look like in our engagement with other countries. If #coronavirus has taught us anything it's that #MadeInAmerica must apply to more than our military https://t.co/HQGenHpgcb

Today is the first day that #ag producers can sign up for direct payments from the @USDA for losses due to #coronavirus . For more information, please visit https://t.co/dIYvSsOdAS. If you are having issues signing up, we are here to help.

A pleasure to visit with University of #Nebraska regent, farmer, and veterinarian Jim Pillen and Mayor Jim Bulkley of Columbus about the fight for farmers and ranchers during this #coronavirus pandemic. @UNLincoln @NEColumbus https://t.co/5F51oUJQ0x

Engaging and informative telephone town hall yesterday on #coronavirus with @unmc Chancellor Dr. Jeff Gold. We covered a range of topics, including screening, testing, and even wedding planning. If you have questions, we’re here to help. https://t.co/ijSm93SlZ7

As Ranking Member on #Ag Appropriations, I just finished a call with @USDA They are announcing right now new economic relief for farmers & ranchers who suffered losses from #coronavirus Signup is Tuesday. Go to https://t.co/DjmjrA6KYv for initial info. We're here if you need help

The #coronavirus crisis has clarified the need to expand our traditional definition of “national security interest” to other categories, including drugs, active drug ingredients, personal protective equipment, and now, from my perspective, our food https://t.co/8DgOM0JB0p

In three separate tranches of massive federal relief, Congress acted to protect our health care system, protect individuals and families, and protect our economic well-being. Today’s act does not reflect the unified bipartisan spirit of those efforts and needs to be reworked

The #coronavirus crisis has brought to light how much of American food production has been sold to foreign operations. We have a process to screen foreign ownership of sensitive technical info. Same should be done for food. I'm a cosponsor of the Agricultural Security Review Act

In this tough time for America, as we protect our health care while protecting our economic well-being, I invite you to review my radio discussion about the Paycheck Protection Program and support for states, localities, ag producers amid #coronavirus https://t.co/RAUskcL3EV #PPP

My hope is that we quickly turn the corner on #coronavirus and spring back to some kind of normalcy while embracing a new paradigm in how we live, work, play. Last week I sent you a survey to gauge the impact of the virus on #Nebraska Here are the results https://t.co/ZGMsxHnmgY

Important, timely conversation last night about America's dangerous dependence on #China for essential drugs, drug ingredients and medical equipment, including face masks needed during #coronavirus . This dynamic will change. I invite you to listen here https://t.co/5A9nBLtEEB

An idea that came out of my #coronavirus survey is the need to indemnify restaurants, grocery stores, and entertainment venues from #COVID19 lawsuits. Small businesses should be able to reopen prudently, in accord with best health practices, without fear of being re-victimized.

In Congress, I'm working to ensure that critical medicines and medical equipment are Made in America. I invite you to review this powerful expose of the dangers of overdependence on #China for essential drugs & drug ingredients https://t.co/qKjDBAk2sr #coronavirus @InvestigateTV

The Paycheck Protection Program continues to roll—it’s the right kind of help for persons who make things and take care of others. Average loan size is about  $76,000, as the smallest of small businesses continue to be prioritized. If you need help we're here for you #coronavirus

Many people are suffering from unemployment. I want to thank the #Nebraska Dept. of Labor for working so diligently with my office to resolve a number of problematic cases. If you need help with getting #unemployment assistance, we’re here for you. @NE_DOL

This weekend, we asked for your opinion on how #coronavirus was impacting you. The survey's early results give a good snapshot of where Nebraskans are, as we continue to fight the virus, protect the sick and return to some degree of normalcy. If you need help, we are here for you https://t.co/Y7PDeJyvob

This week Congress replenished the important Paycheck Protection Program for small businesses and employees affected by #coronavirus At nearly 20,000 loans, #Nebraska continues to lead the U.S. in per capita #PPP loans approved. If you're struggling to get PPP, we're here to help

Communities across #Nebraska have been hurt by #coronavirus -related tax revenue loss. I’m sure that no one wants to see police officers and firefighters laid off. The FLEX Bill rightly opens previously approved federal relief funds to help. @Leirion4Lincoln @Jean_Stothert
Really good discussion with @AARP today about their concerns over the extreme social isolation for people in long-term care facilities due to #coronavirus @AARPNE

Starting with the bio-containment of passengers from the Diamond Princess cruise ship, the University of Nebraska Medical Center has led America's #coronavirus response. A clinical trial of a drug that began with one of the passengers has started to show promise @unmc #remdesivir

A break for a moment from #coronavirus Really appreciated dialogue today w/ @SecretaryCarson of Housing & Urban Development about new possibilities thru public/private partnerships for resilient, healthy, nourishing communities—an impt initiative we're building toward in Congress

Thank you Terry of the Alzheimer's Association and others on today's Zoom call. Something we don't think about during #coronavirus : #Alzheimers caregivers are doing double duty––caring for at-risk patients while implementing social distancing, which is so hard on care routines.
Thank you @Zoetis for hosting today's telephone town hall and working so hard to keep the animal health industry afloat during this difficult time as we work through the challenges of #coronavirus

The Paycheck Protection Program started up again today with over $300 billion in new congressionally authorized funding. If you have questions about the #PPP or have other #coronavirus concerns, we are here to help you.
We're all managing the best we can amid #coronavirus Today is #ArborDay –– a homegrown bright spot in this tough spring! Trees—nature’s wonder! @arborday

Congress passed and today the President signed Phase 3.5 of #coronavirus relief––$310B to replenish the important Paycheck Protection Program for small business; $75B for hospitals; $25B for testing. We are here to help. #PPP @realDonaldTrump

Although the Capitol has mostly shut down, the tulips still stand guard right outside like sentinels. A little sign of normalcy amidst all of this suffering. @uscapitol @NatlGardening #coronavirus https://t.co/NXIt5HcEUq

The Paycheck Protection Program has been a bipartisan airlift, a lifesaver for people who make things with their own two hands and take care of others under their employ. I will shortly support legislation to replenish the #PPP , help rural hospitals and expand testing.

Sign of the times. At a nearly empty Eppley Airport in #Omaha on way back to vote in DC for increased support of important Paycheck Protection Program, rural hospitals, and #coronavirus testing. https://t.co/z39sbrZhvW

Thank you to the Food Bank of Lincoln for your tremendous service to our community. Behind me is a quarter-mile-long line of cars with so many people in need of a little extra help. The new @USDA program will move more food soon. #coronavirus @SecretarySonny @FoodBankLincoln https://t.co/JYk8MmPOBt

Here’s the next deal under consideration for our country: $450B in further #coronavirus relief––$300B for Paycheck Protection Program, $50B for Economic Injury Disaster Loan program, $25B for testing, $75B for hospitals, with special focus on helping under-banked small businesses

I also discussed with @SecretarySonny the sweeping problem of rolling processing plant closures and the possibility of best practices for testing and sanitation emanating from Nebraska for use nationwide––to keep disease out and our food supply uninterrupted @USDA @unmc

Pleasure to join #Nebraska pharmacists today—thanks for all you are doing to keep us healthy and safe during the #coronavirus pandemic. Going forward, let’s work together to ensure that critical medicines are Made in America. @NebraskaPharm

Children’s Hospital and Medical Center in Omaha has pointed out a problem with children’s hospitals being unfairly left out of federal #coronavirus relief funds. We’ve notified Health and Human Services Secretary Azar looking for a potential fix. @SecAzar @ChildrensOmaha

As co-chair of the International Conservation Caucus, today I joined an innovative virtual caucus briefing on links between the illegal trade in exotic wildlife and "spillover" into human pandemics. I invite you to watch here. #coronavirus @TheICCFGroup https://t.co/Rv7SB9ez15

In the midst of our fight against #coronavirus , it’s important to celebrate a bit of good news. The PPP loan program helped Steve Glenn of Executive Travel in Lincoln re-open his business. Here’s the virtual ribbon- cutting. @SBA_Nebraska @SBAgov  https://t.co/IQvLsM1rrB
I invite you to review my interview on Full Court Press with Greta Van Susteren on how #Nebraska is fighting #coronavirus and helping our country. @unmc @greta https://t.co/25LXS9oxsX

As I learned from Treasury Secretary Mnuchin today, over one million small businesses are participating in the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP). If you are facing any challenge in this regard, we are here to help. #PPPLoans #coronavirus

Thanks to the good people at the People’s City Mission Help Center, working hard to help others. @PCMLincoln
 #coronavirus https://t.co/I9RmfSaxVu
In our call this week with Vice President Mike Pence, he asked that we share these important health precautions with you. @Mike_Pence #coronavirus https://t.co/iTpICDODvF
We continue to work through issues with the rollout of the important Payment Protection Program for small businesses. Let us know if we can help you. #coronavirus #PPPloan
A happy story in the midst of #coronavirus . Welcome home from Peru, Eric and Mackenzie Savaiano. Glad things finally worked out! https://t.co/E08IkFyy4W

Just finished a telephone town hall on #coronavirus with Dr. Gold of @unmc . Important questions––and answers––on protecting #ag economy, contact tracing, developments in antibody testing and medical dynamics around keeping patients off ventilators. https://t.co/gheigz9Y6v
Per my call today with @USDA , excess food supplies due to drop in restaurant and school demand are being moved into food banks for those in need. #coronavirus
It has begun. Japan is moving significant manufacturing out of #China due to dangerous trade dependence exposed by #coronavirus https://t.co/h2nUDMOLIc
Great conversation on KLIN’s “Road to Recovery” last night about what your federal government is doing to help you, your family, and small business during #coronavirus https://t.co/6tuPq8J4Dd

Thanks to roughly 60 businesses who participated in the #Columbus Chamber webinar. We discussed three primary federal funding options: Paycheck Protection Program, Emergency Injury Disaster Loan, and tax credit. You can review the event here https://t.co/xoyyGYIFv8 #coronavirus
Really proud of staff member Rita Sanders of #Bellevue who, in addition to her many obligations, has found the time to sew two hundred masks. #coronavirus https://t.co/ZwTSYJZbCZ

Just finished a call with Vice President Pence, Dr. Fauci, Dr. Birx, and Treasury Secretary Mnuchin. A hint of good news: in the early crisis states of #California and #Washington, social distancing is working. #coronavirus
Per Administrator Seema Verma, the first wave of money is coming to hospitals this week for #Medicare reimbursement. This should be particularly helpful to our rural communities. #coronavirus #ag

The Paycheck Protection Program for small businesses is working—helping our communities fight through this virus. It’s so popular that Congress needs to give it additional support—we are working on it now. Here to help. #PPP #PPPloan #coronavirus
As Nebraska fights back #coronavirus , here are answers to your frequently asked questions. We are here for you https://t.co/iPwtb49PIi

Amid the challenges to persons, families and small business, so refreshing to speak to Pastor Tom Barber of People's City Mission, "Lincoln’s safety net since 1907." Pastor Tom informed me that The Mission is open—Help Center as well––for anyone in need @PCMLincoln #coronavirus https://t.co/XSHdU1zTYy

Yesterday, I conducted a telephone town hall with @unmc Chancellor Dr. Gold. We had a number of wide-ranging, good questions––and answers––about #coronavirus , protective measures, restriction of liberties, drug prices and #China . I invite you to listen https://t.co/bhhoWUf2kK

The Payment Protection Program for small business rolled out today. We continue to work with banks and the SBA to smooth out wrinkles. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact my office. We are here for you. @SBAgov #coronavirus #PPPloan

Protecting our food supply is critical during this national crisis. We’ve asked Ag Secretary Perdue to move immediate assistance to cattle producers who have been hard hit by #coronavirus @SecretarySonny  https://t.co/c8gkLtuC84

As traumatic as #coronavirus has been for America, I'm so proud of Nebraskans. We have been very compliant. And we understand the magnitude of the moment––with so many beautiful stories of neighbor helping neighbor and people sacrificing for one another. My office is here for you

Even amidst our national fight against coronavirus, high-level wit is always welcome! After learning the Kennedy Center received $25 million in the #coronavirus relief bill, one Nebraskan asked with characteristic Husker humor: “Where are my tickets?”

Appreciated the opportunity to attend Governor Ricketts' press conference today, where he gave a great deal of important guidance––such as Nebraskans returning from out-of-state #coronavirus hot spots, including Colorado, should quarantine for 14 days @GovRicketts

If you have a question about federal #coronavirus relief for which you, your family, or small business are eligible, here are some answers to frequent questions. For help with more technical issues or other concerns, please let me know. We are here for you https://t.co/NyU3D37vOQ

The Nebraska federal delegation has sent a letter to President Trump in support of Governor Ricketts’s major disaster declaration for #Nebraska due to effects of #coronavirus on our state @realDonaldTrump

As our country fights back against #coronavirus, please know we are here to help. If you have questions about the Cares Act just passed by Congress, let me know. I will keep posting answers to commonly asked questions. 
https://t.co/Ba9PYtGEw6

It was necessary to act. I invite you to listen to a discussion of my support for congressional action to fight #coronavirus—plus what may be next—with Julie Mason on @SIRIUSXM @POTUSPressPool https://t.co/3jvlNccyLQ

The Cares Act just passed Congress to help individuals and families, small business and our health care system overcome this pandemic. Given rapidly changing dynamics around #coronavirus I put together a list of answers to your questions about the new law https://t.co/kybqncgWPf

This is an unprecedented crisis, requiring an unprecedented response. With this battle plan from our government—and the sacrifice and courage of the American people—we will fight back, we will help our sick, and we will restore our great nation. I support the bill. #coronavirus

Given the rapidly changing dynamic in our country around #coronavirus, I put together a list of answers to frequently asked questions about federal assistance under consideration by the U.S. House of Representatives. https://t.co/O4gWw4HoEt

This afternoon I held a telephone town hall with local small businesses to discuss federal resources available to them as we turn the corner on #coronavirus . I invite you to listen: https://t.co/A4NTbHzqL4

Important conversation on KFAB Radio this morning regarding the unprecedented federal response to #coronavirus . I invite you to listen: 

https://t.co/gSmy2thQ70
A former colleague of mine famously said: “Never let a serious crisis go to waste." Here’s a better message: Don't let a crisis go without addressing the crisis. #coronavirus

In the midst of #coronavirus , it may sound peculiar to note that this is #NationalAgDay . But our food supply is safe and abundant. Thanks to America's farmers and ranchers––and all those who move our food from farm to table. @USDA @SecretarySonny

To help Nebraskans understand the current policy dynamics in play, I have crafted a summary sheet of legislation under consideration right now to Protect Health, Protect Workers, and Protect Small Business: https://t.co/4c5crGBy5W #coronavirus

During this difficult time for our country, the Senate needs to act quickly to protect America’s health care, workers, and small businesses. There is too much uncertainty. No time for delay. #coronavirus

As I write, Congress is considering and expected to pass a very large piece of legislation that will send checks directly to many Americans, and direct assistance to small businesses in dire circumstances. https://t.co/L7FgPyIAVp #CoronaVirusUpdate #coronavirus
If you can, one way to help during this tough time is to buy gift cards from small businesses. A good program rolling out Monday: https://t.co/thvprnHsal #coronavirus

Thanks to all who participated in today's telephone town hall on #coronavirus Important discussion on federal response, supplies, small business impacts and helping persons in need. This is a tough moment for our country. We are here to help. https://t.co/KxEL7sxAT2

Important conversation on Rural Radio today about the federal response to #coronavirus—protecting health, protecting workers, protecting small business, and maintaining food security  

https://t.co/j3gNb7GY2e

Just got off the phone with the Secretary of Agriculture and the Commissioner of the Food and Drug Administration. Our nation’s food supply is sound and uninterrupted. One small way we can help our struggling  restaurants is #TakeOutFriday @USDA #coronavirus

Today the Senate passed and President signed the Families First CoronaVirus Response Act. I previously voted for it in House. Provides free #coronavirus testing and paid sick leave for affected workers. Builds on our earlier $8.3B bill to protect America https://t.co/usgY8lqZoU
We will see a spike of #coronavirus cases in the coming days as testing increases. Hopefully, we will flatten by next week and turn the corner.
Extraordinary moments call for extraordinary measures. We must immediately consider funds for small businesses in dire circumstances—and persons who need cash. #coronavirus

The #coronavirus pandemic is a serious threat to our country. We are fighting back to secure our healthcare system, protect America’s small businesses, and meet your family’s needs. Here is a document I wrote on the current state of the legislative process https://t.co/XbLqEpYyff

The House has passed the Families First CoronaVirus Response Act with my support. It provides free #coronavirus testing and paid sick leave for affected workers. It builds on our earlier $8.3B bill to protect America. Upon Senate passage, the President has committed to sign it.

Today, the President declared a national emergency on coronavirus. Last night, I hosted a telephone town hall for Nebraskans on #coronavirus with @unmc Chancellor Jeff Gold. I invite you to listen to the questions and answers in our thoughtful discussion 
https://t.co/jhkADAZH44

The President just declared a national emergency on #coronavirus It includes expanded telehealth screening, plus drive-through testing for those who need it. Google will have a website telling you where to go. Congress is working on a bipartisan initiative to provide further help

I invite you to review last night's telephone town hall with UNMC Chancellor Dr. Jeffrey Gold. I updated Nebraskans on actions the government is taking to protect them. Dr. Gold provided critical updates on #coronavirus and best health practices  @unmc 

https://t.co/twHVJdXEqr

Due to government action to suspend travel from infected areas of #China and to place Americans from infected areas into quarantine, we gave America time to prepare. Now, with new resources from Congress, we're equipped for a full response to #coronavirus https://t.co/GrMVPbTRiF

University of #Nebraska Medical Center is a leader in infectious disease treatment and containment. Pleased that UNMC Chancellor Dr. Gold joined me today to give you the latest #coronavirus update––both what we're doing in DC and back home to keep you safe https://t.co/LoL6OUQFja

The House just passed a #coronavirus emergency bill. I voted for it. Half the funding goes to testing, treatments and vaccine development. Other money goes to state and local preparation and response and to ensure our drug supply is safe and available @US_FDA

I invite you to listen to a national radio interview about what #coronavirus revealed about #China and what we are doing in Congress to protect you, your family, and community 

https://t.co/BPuv2e6TXK

Important update on #coronvirus today at the University of Nebraska Medical Center. Pleased to join Chancellor Gold, Governor Ricketts, and the incredible medical staff to say goodbye to two patients on their way home. @unmc

The raging #coronavirus has called attention to an overlooked problem. In the name of global profiteering, we’ve enabled dangerous outsourcing of drug production to foreign countries—a significant portion to the very place of origin of coronavirus in China https://t.co/VgNRv0CJvc
